value.title: DAX Fridays #176: Speed up your Direct Query reports with a single click (kindof...).
value.excerpt: Are your direct query reports slow?   In this video I will show you how to speed up your direct query reports with this trick. value.title: DAX Fridays! #181: Can't covert text into dates using DAX? Here is why...

Enjoy!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX fridays! #19: DIVIDE
value.excerpt: Let's go through DIVIDE() function available in DAX! value.title: DAX Fridays! #66: TREATAS
value.excerpt: In this video we will go through the DAX function TREATAS.  The TREATAS DAX function allows us to create virtual relationships within tables or pass filters to tables that are not related.  Link to function in glossary:  https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/treatas-dax   Link to SQLBI blog post: https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/propagate-filters-using-treatas-in-dax/

Main topics?  Is average a good measure ? When is average a bad metric to use? Calculate median Calculate mode.  Here is the website

value.title: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression
value.excerpt: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression Vertipaq is the database and engine that runs on top of Power BI and PowerPivot.   When we import data in Power BI, the Vertipaq database will try with a series of algorithms, to compress the data as much as possible and the best way possible

value.title: DAX Functions Overview - Date and Time Function in Power BI
value.excerpt: Welcome to my new series – “Wednesday with DAX”. This is the first video of this series. The first episode covers all Date and Time functions used in Power BI In this video, we will talk about Date and Time functions in Power BI. We will discuss about most useful date and time functions in Power BI.
